job_description:
Senior Business Analyst

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead requirement workshops, client calls, and discovery discussions to understand business needs clearly.
  • Ask deeper questions, challenge assumptions, and validate the true business intent behind every requirement.
  • Convert ambiguous client inputs into structured, logical, and actionable functional understanding.
  • Break large features into modules, workflows, components, and clear dependencies.
  • Build strong system-level understanding involving APIs, integrations, data flow, and backend considerations.
  • Translate business processes into functional logic that development teams can execute.
  • Decompose requirements into use-case flows, system behaviours, edge cases, alternate paths, validation rules, and dependencies.
  • Prepare high-quality documentation, including BRD, FRD, SRS, workflows, state diagrams, data-flow diagrams, API requirement specs, and acceptance criteria.
  • Ensure all documentation is clear, logical, structured, testable, and ready for developers and QA to use.
  • Collaborate closely with developers, architects, QA, and product owners to validate feasibility and align understanding.
  • Ensure QA teams can derive test cases effectively from your functional logic and acceptance criteria.
  • Communicate confidently with clients, handle requirement discussions smoothly, and clarify misunderstandings immediately.
  • Push back politely on unclear or changing requirements and ensure final decisions are documented properly.
  • Maintain requirement traceability throughout the lifecycle and ensure zero ambiguity during handover to development.
  • Own the entire requirement lifecycle from discovery to development readiness with high accountability.
  • Drive clarity across teams by ensuring every requirement is complete, validated, and logically consistent.

Required Skills & Experience

  • Minimum 4+ years of core Business Analyst experience with strong analytical and system-level thinking.
  • Ability to break down complex requirements into clear components, workflows, and functional logic.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication with confidence in client interactions and clarifications.
  • Proven experience in preparing SRS, BRD, FRD, workflows, and acceptance criteria with high clarity.
  • Ability to challenge assumptions politely, ask the right questions, and ensure zero ambiguity.
  • Strong collaboration experience with development, QA, architects, and cross-functional teams.
  • Understanding of API behaviours, integrations, data flows, and multi-module system interactions.
  • Ability to run requirement discussions, workshops, and independently lead discovery sessions.
  • Exposure to SaaS, scalable products, automation, or AI-supported systems is an added advantage.
  • Demonstrated ownership of requirements end-to-end, ensuring developer-ready and testable outputs.
  • Not suitable for UI-only thinkers, passive communicators, template-based writers, or those relying on AI for answers.
  • Success is defined by clear, testable requirements, zero rework, strong cross-team alignment, and confident communication.
  • Candidates must align with 2Base’s structured thinking, clarity-driven culture, and transformation of the BA function.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field
  • 4 to 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst
  • Experience in SaaS or scalable product environments
  • Exposure to AI/Automation, integrations, or multi-module systems
  • Ability to run independent client workshops
  • Must have independently handled requirement ownership for at least one full project lifecycle

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Senior Business Analyst with 4-8 years of experience required to translate complex requirements into structured functional logic, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and ensure testable, developer-ready outputs in SaaS environments.

job_description:
Business Analyst

Job Description

The Business Analyst plays a key role in ensuring requirements are clearly understood, accurately documented, and traceable throughout the software development lifecycle. This role focuses on translating business and functional inputs into structured, standardized documentation that supports effective development, testing, and delivery. Working closely with business analysts, design teams, and technical stakeholders, the role ensures consistency, clarity, and alignment across all requirement artifacts.

Key Responsibilities - Create Software Requirement Specifications (SRS) based on inputs from Core Business Analysts, stakeholder discussions, and requirement walkthroughs - Prepare Business Requirement Documents (BRD) using approved templates while ensuring business intent and system behavior are clearly documented - Participate in requirement discussions to understand business objectives, functional flows, dependencies, and assumptions before documentation - Analyze requirements to identify gaps, ambiguities, and inconsistencies, and work with Core BAs to resolve them - Document functional flows, business rules, and acceptance criteria where applicable to support development and QA teams - Document wireframes, UI flows, validations, and UI specifications in collaboration with design and product teams - Maintain change logs, version history, and document updates throughout the project lifecycle - Create and manage traceability matrices linking business, functional, and technical requirements - Maintain cross-references across BRD, SRS, UI, API, and related documentation - Ensure documentation consistency, completeness, and alignment with approved scope and delivery timelines - Ensure accurate and timely PMS updates with structured documentation details - Support development, QA, UAT, and audit processes through clear, traceable, and up-to-date documentation - Assist in requirement reviews, walkthroughs, and validation sessions with internal and client stakeholders

Requirements Required Skills and Experience - 1 to 4 years of experience in Business Analysis documentation or related roles - Strong experience in BRD and SRS creation - Hands-on experience with documentation templates, standards, and version control - Ability to document UI wireframes and functional flows clearly - Working knowledge of APIs and system integrations for documentation purposes - Experience with project management systems and documentation tools - Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple documents in parallel - Excellent written communication and stakeholder coordination skills

Minimum Qualifications - Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field - 1 to 4 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst

Benefits - A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

Contact If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: The Business Analyst translates business needs into structured documentation, collaborating with teams to ensure clarity and alignment. Responsibilities include creating BRDs/SRS, documenting flows, and maintaining traceability for development and QA.

Contact

For applications, email your resume to jobs@armia.com.

job_description:
Sr. Business Development Manager

Maple Tech Space is an IT consultancy firm based in Canada, established in 2020 with a head office in Ontario and offshore offices in Kerala, India. MTS specializes in IT consulting, Digital Marketing, App Development, and Web services. The company is product-oriented, with three successful products in the Canadian market and over 1000 clients.

AgentRoof, a fast-growing PropTech company under MTS, empowers real estate professionals in Canada and the US with websites, CRM, lead generation, and social media marketing services. We are expanding our sales team and seeking aggressive, high-performing Senior Business Development Managers with proven leadership skills to drive consistent results.

Role & Responsibilities: - Sales Ownership & Strategy: Drive individual and team sales performance across US/Canada markets, ensuring consistent achievement of monthly and quarterly targets. - Cold Calling & Prospecting: Oversee outbound calling strategies; guide the team to maintain 60–80 outbound calls per day per rep while personally engaging in high-value prospecting. - Pitching & Presentations: Deliver and standardize impactful product pitches (websites, CRM, marketing services) and train the team on value-based selling. - Demo Management: Supervise scheduling, conducting, and closing of demos; lead complex demos and assist the team in deal closures. - Lead Conversion: Drive high lead-to-client conversion rates; ensure minimum monthly sign-up targets are met at both individual and team levels. - Client Retention: Build and manage key client relationships, drive upsell/cross-sell initiatives, and ensure renewals and long-term retention. - Team Management & Training: Recruit, onboard, train, mentor, and manage a team of Business Development Managers; conduct regular coaching, call reviews, and performance feedback sessions. - Performance Tracking: Set KPIs, monitor daily activities (calls, demos, conversions), and implement corrective actions to improve team performance. - CRM Management: Ensure accurate CRM usage, pipeline hygiene, activity tracking, and consistent follow-ups across the team. - Market Insights: Gather customer objections, competitor intelligence, and market trends; share insights with leadership to improve sales strategies and product offerings.

Requirements: - Experience: 4–6+ years in outbound sales/business development for US/Canada clients, with 1–2 years in a team lead or managerial role (SaaS or Real Estate experience preferred). - Skills: Strong expertise in cold calling, product pitching, negotiation, deal closure, and sales coaching. - Language Proficiency: English – Mandatory (excellent spoken & written communication). Knowledge of Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada, Malayalam, or other regional languages is a plus. - Personality: Highly driven, persuasive, energetic leader with strong influencing and decision-making abilities. - Performance: Proven track record of consistently achieving or exceeding individual and team sales targets. - Tech-Savvy: Hands-on experience with CRM tools, lead management systems, reporting dashboards, and virtual demo platforms (Zoom/Meet). - Flexibility: Willingness to work night shifts aligned with North American time zones.

What We Offer: - Competitive salary + attractive performance-based incentives. - Opportunity to work with a high-growth PropTech brand in Canada/US markets. - Fast career progression for high performers. - Work-from-home flexibility with international exposure. - Dynamic and young team culture.

Location: Work from Home (Night Shift: 6:00 PM – 3:00 AM IST) Industry: Real Estate Tech (Websites, CRM, Lead Generation & Marketing Services)

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@mapletechspace.com.
summary: Lead sales and team management for a PropTech company in Canada/US markets, focusing on websites, CRM, and marketing services with work-from-home flexibility.

job_description:
About the Job

As a specialist in electronics and software for the past 20 years, in-tech is a dynamic, fast-growing engineering company headquartered in Munich, Germany, employing around 2,350 employees globally across 20 project locations in 8 countries. Now a strategic partner of Infosys Ltd since 2024 after becoming a 100% subsidiary, in-tech is expanding its capabilities to meet growing digital engineering demands. Our India locations blend Indian and European work cultures, fostering a collaborative environment. With expansion into Kerala and other Indian states, we seek a Facilities Manager to support high-quality engineering facilities across a multi-site portfolio.

This role offers onsite and hybrid work options. If you thrive in a dynamic, flexible setting and want to grow with an expanding team, we’d love to connect with you!

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Hands-on leadership to assess environments, drive change, and manage facilities as the business expands.
  • Oversee daily operations of multiple sites, maintaining high standards for buildings, equipment, and grounds.
  • Conduct regular inspections to identify maintenance needs, safety risks, and improvement opportunities.
  • Manage planned preventative maintenance (PPM) and reactive repairs efficiently.

job_description:
About Lean Transition Solutions (LTS)

LTS is a global Operational Excellence and Lean Industry 4.0 software company headquartered in the UK. For over a decade, we’ve helped large organizations turn strategy into action by combining Lean thinking, leadership principles, and modern, scalable technology. We are proud to be trusted by leading global organizations, supporting them in building sustainable, people-centric transformation at scale.

With teams across India, Europe, the US, the Middle East, and Mexico, we operate as one connected global team. At LTS, we believe technology strengthens people, enabling them to do their best work. That belief shapes our products, our culture, and how we work together.

Location: Technopark Phase 1, Trivandrum

Role Overview

The Pre-Sales Demo Executive is responsible for delivering a best-in-class demo and trial experience across the company’s SaaS portfolio. This role owns the end-to-end demo readiness lifecycle from environments, data, and scenarios to leadership briefings and meeting preparedness, ensuring that Sales, Pre-Sales, and Senior Leadership consistently present a compelling, confident, and professional product narrative to prospective customers.

This is a senior individual contributor role with high visibility and influence, requiring strong ownership, attention to detail, and the ability to proactively drive standards across multiple teams.

Experience: 1-3 Years

Key Responsibilities

  1. Demo Environment Ownership
  2. Own and manage all demo environments across web and mobile platforms
  3. Ensure systems are stable, current, and demo-ready at all times
  4. Coordinate with Engineering and IT for deployments, updates, fixes, and environment health

  5. Act as a super user with full system privileges and deep functional understanding

  6. Demo Scenarios & Data Excellence

  7. Design, create, and maintain multiple demo scenarios per product, including role-based and industry-specific scenarios
  8. Create realistic, high-quality demo datasets that clearly showcase product value
  9. Refresh and reset demo data to maintain consistency and reliability

  10. Ensure all demo data complies with GDPR and internal data governance standards

  11. Demo Flow Definition & Documentation

  12. Define and document the ideal demo flow for each product, user role, and scenario
  13. Maintain clear demo runbooks, scripts, and supporting guidance

  14. Continuously refine demo flows based on feedback from Sales, Pre-Sales, and Leadership

  15. Access & Credential Management

  16. Manage demo login credentials and access (manual process)
  17. Ensure credentials are secure, up to date, and readily available for internal use
  18. Coordinate access approvals with the Pre-Sales Leader

  19. Maintain clear documentation of demo users and permissions

  20. Sales, Pre-Sales & Leadership Enablement

  21. Ensure demo readiness 3–5 days ahead of scheduled meetings
  22. Support teams with demo confirmations, demo paths, and pre-meeting briefs
  23. Provide concise daily or weekly summaries of planned demos and priorities

  24. Attend key demos or leadership meetings where appropriate and value-adding

  25. Meeting Preparation & Collateral Readiness

  26. Ensure leadership and sales teams have the correct decks, tools, and demo environments
  27. Maintain a single source of truth for demo assets and supporting materials

  28. Work closely with Product and Marketing teams to ensure consistent messaging

  29. Standards, Governance & Continuous Improvement

  30. Establish and enforce a standard demo workflow across teams
  31. Act as the quality gatekeeper for demo and trial experiences
  32. Capture demo feedback and share insights with Product and Pre-Sales teams
  33. Support long-term evolution towards PMO or Product Operations functions

Preferred Skills

  • Experience in pre-sales, demo operations, product enablement, or SaaS operations roles
  • Strong understanding of SaaS platforms and demo environments
  • Ability to manage multiple systems and stakeholders
  • Excellent documentation and organisation skills
  • Confident communicator with senior leadership
  • Strong ownership mindset
  • Experience supporting enterprise or regulated customers
  • Familiarity with GDPR and data governance
  • Exposure to CRM or pre-sales workflows
  • Background suitable for PMO or delivery governance progression

Why You’ll Love Working With Us

  • Meaningful Work with Global Impact: Contribute to enterprise platforms used by world-class organizations such as Philips, Hitachi, Pfizer, and other global leaders—helping them improve how they operate, lead, and grow.
  • People-First, Collaborative Culture: Your ideas are heard, your work is valued, and you’re supported by a team built on trust and respect.
  • Purpose-Driven Technology: Build practical, thoughtful products that solve real operational and leadership challenges.
  • Growth & Ownership: Learn continuously, take ownership of your work, and grow your career in a supportive environment.
  • Global Exposure, Human Connection: Work with diverse teams and enterprise clients worldwide—while feeling connected and supported.
  • Quality, Security & Trust: Our platforms and processes are backed by internationally recognised ISO certifications, reflecting our strong commitment to quality, data security, and operational reliability. This means you work in an environment built on high standards and trust.

Build a Strong Future Together

At LTS, we don’t just deliver solutions—we build long-term relationships. Together, we create a strong, sustainable future for our people, our clients, and our organization. From continuous learning and career development opportunities to meaningful ownership in your work, we support you at every stage of your journey. Our people benefit from a supportive work environment, competitive benefits, and a culture that values balance, trust, and long-term success.

At LTS, your growth is our growth—and when our people succeed, everything we build becomes stronger.

Interested candidates may forward their detailed resume to: careers@ltslean.com and include the following information in the email content:

  • Current CTC:
  • Expected CTC:
  • Notice Period:
  • Current Location:
  • Total Relevant Experience:
  • Willingness to work at office:
summary: Senior Pre-Sales Demo Executive role managing SaaS demo environments, scenarios, and data to enable sales teams. Requires 1-3 years of experience in pre-sales or SaaS operations.

About Lean Transition Solutions (LTS)

LTS is a global Operational Excellence and Lean Industry 4.0 software company headquartered in the UK. For over a decade, we’ve helped large organizations turn strategy into action by combining Lean thinking, leadership principles, and modern, scalable technology. We are trusted by leading global organizations to build sustainable, people-centric transformations at scale. With teams across India, Europe, the US, the Middle East, and Mexico, we operate as one connected global team. At LTS, we believe technology strengthens people, enabling them to do their best work.

Location

Technopark Phase 1, Trivandrum, 695581

Role Overview

We’re seeking a QA Lead to oversee quality assurance across our software products. You’ll lead junior QA engineers, own all test planning and execution, implement modern test automation practices, and work closely with stakeholders to ensure top-notch delivery quality.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead and mentor junior QA engineers, providing guidance and skill development
  • Communicate testing status and quality metrics to technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Design and implement QA strategy, test plans, and quality standards
  • Build and maintain automated testing frameworks using Playwright, Cypress, or similar tools
  • Collaborate with Product, Development, and Project Management teams on release planning
  • Track quality metrics and drive continuous improvement initiatives

Required Qualifications

  • 4+ years of QA experience with 1+ years in a lead/senior role
  • Proven experience leading and mentoring QA team members
  • Hands-on expertise with modern automation tools (Playwright, Cypress, or Selenium)
  • Proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript for test automation
  • Knowledge of CI/CD tools and processes for integrating test automation pipelines
  • Excellent communication skills with ability to engage technical and business stakeholders
  • Strong understanding of Agile methodologies and software development lifecycle
  • Self-motivated with analytical problem-solving abilities

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience in SaaS or B2B software environments
  • Background in manufacturing or industrial software
  • API and performance testing experience

Why You’ll Love Working With Us

  • Meaningful Work with Global Impact: Contribute to enterprise platforms used by world-class organizations like Philips, Hitachi, and Pfizer.
  • People-First, Collaborative Culture: Your ideas are heard, your work is valued, and you’re supported by a team built on trust and respect.
  • Purpose-Driven Technology: Build practical, thoughtful products solving real operational and leadership challenges.
  • Growth & Ownership: Learn continuously, take ownership of your work, and grow your career in a supportive environment.
  • Global Exposure, Human Connection: Work with diverse teams and enterprise clients worldwide—while feeling connected and supported.
